{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cervical vertebrae are distinct from the thoracic vertebrae in several ways. According to Document [14], one of the most notable distinctions is the presence of a foramen in each transverse process in the cervical vertebrae. This feature is not mentioned as being present in the thoracic vertebrae in any of the documents. Therefore, the answer is that the typical cervical vertebra differs from the thoracic vertebra in that it has a foramen transversarium.", "answer_choice": "B"}
